title: The Block teams mock Shaynna Blaze after she broke down in tears over the 'healing' colours
text:
The Block's design expert Shaynna Blaze broke down in tears on Sunday night.

And on Monday night's episode, teams certainly didn't hold back when they joked about her emotional outburst during the room reveals.

The 56-year-old was moved to tears due to the 'healing' colour palette used by Andy and Deb in their studio apartment.

Teasing! The Block teams have mocked Shaynna Blaze after she broke down in tears over the 'healing' colours used in Andy and Deb's studio apartment reveal on Sunday night

However, rather than console the emotional creative, the teams instead gave her a good old fashioned ribbing.

Despite the emotion being somewhat of a compliment to Andy and Deb, Andy was quick off the mark to joke about it.

Andy started by mocking Shaynna by pretending to cry: 'I love this space,' he said, in an exaggerated way before clawing his hand up dramatically.

Everything ok? Next up was stylish grandads Mitch and Mark (pictured), with Mitch pretending to break down as he walked into the room's entry way.

Next up was stylish grandads Mitch and Mark, with Mitch pretending to break down as he walked into the room's entry way.

Meanwhile, competitors Jesse and Mel and Tess and Luke also teased Shaynna for her over the top emotional response to the room.

'What is Shaynna on about?' Jesse said, clearly flabbergasted by the tears. While partner Mel added: 'Yeah, I'm not crying. This is standard Deb and Andy.'

'What is Shaynna on about?' Jesse (pictured) said, clearly flabbergasted by the tears. While partner Mel added: 'Yeah, I'm not crying. This is standard Deb and Andy.'

While Tess was decidedly more candid: 'I love this colour,' she began, before describing it as Shaynna's tears.

Inspecting Andy and Deb's bedroom during their studio apartment reveal, Shaynna was moved by the 'healing' colour palette and was momentarily speechless.

'I can't talk...,' she told co-judges Neale Whitaker and Darren Palmer, before saying: 'This is stunning... wow. It's so gentle.'

Aesthetic: The room featured a colour palette of all-white with subtle pops of teak wood. Shaynna is pictured with co-judges Neale Whitaker (left) and Darren Palmer (right)

Welling up in tears, Shaynna added: 'I just think, you know when a house is built with love and I think that's what I'm connecting with at the moment.

'There's something very healing about this interior,' she added.

The Block continues Monday at 7.30pm on Channel Nine.
